meanings.sent1: She enjoys intercalating colorful beads into her bracelet.
meanings.sent2: The chef is intercalating layers of cheese in the lasagna.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was intercalating acorns in between the branches of the tree.
meanings.sent4: The artist intercalated splashes of red paint among the blue strokes on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The gardener intercalated rows of flowers to create a beautiful pattern.

meanings.definition: Adding (an extra day or month) to the calendar.
meanings.sent1: They are intercalating an extra day to February this year.
meanings.sent2: The committee decided to intercalate an additional month to the lunar calendar.
meanings.sent3: The students were surprised when the teacher intercalated an extra day to the school year.
meanings.sent4: The astronomer intercalated an extra month to align the lunar cycle with the solar year.
meanings.sent5: The farmer intercalated an extra month to ensure a longer growing season.
